update.description:
* Add new WideAngleCameraSensor
* WideAngleCamera contains Lens description that allows flexible control over the projection
* New transport message type to control camera lens, and read it's state

Camera renders the world 6 times in different directions, to cube map texture. Then Ogre::Compositor is used to map the world to camera sensor according to the lens properties

It depends on [Pull request to sdformat #215](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/215/camera-lens-description)
update.title: WideAngle Camera

content.raw: Should it be in Gazebo 6 or 7 section?
content.html: Should it be in Gazebo 6 or 7 section?

content.raw: Yes, please. Merge default into your branch and solve the conflicts before committing.
content.html: Yes, please. Merge default into your branch and solve the conflicts before committing.

content.raw: Do we need to group both headers together? I'm not sure why, but my pc has `GL/gl.h` but not `GL/glew.h`. The same seems to be the case for the Jenkins machine. Is glew needed at all? I think earlier versions of this branch didn't have it.

* Add new WideAngleCameraSensor
* WideAngleCamera contains Lens description that allows flexible control over the projection
* New transport message type to control camera lens, and read it's state

Camera renders the world 6 times in different directions, to cube map texture. Then Ogre::Compositor is used to map the world to camera sensor according to the lens properties

update.title: WideAngle Camera

content.raw:
It is the reason I enable GL_ARB_seamless_cube_map extention, which enables cross-face filtering. It works with open-source drivers on Intel, nouveau, and amd, but i have not tested with nvidia blob. The extention is supported almost on every desktop GPU that had driver updates since 2009, not only with OpenGL 3.1 support.

PS. Intel and nouveau heve this enabled by default.
content.html:
It is the reason I enable GL_ARB_seamless_cube_map extention, which enables cross-face filtering. It works with open-source drivers on Intel, nouveau, and amd, but i have not tested with nvidia blob. The extention is supported almost on every desktop GPU that had driver updates since 2009, not only with OpenGL 3.1 support.

PS. Intel and nouveau heve this enabled by default.

content.raw: Like goal, purpose or objective, rename it? The message could be send in both sides: the lens creates a topic and publish it's state to it, in that case destiny is set to INFO. The lens also subscribes to anther topic and listens for SET messages, to modify it's state. Actually this field is not strictly necessary, but it makes clear what this message is for.
content.html: Like goal, purpose or objective, rename it? The message could be send in both sides: the lens creates a topic and publish it's state to it, in that case destiny is set to INFO. The lens also subscribes to anther topic and listens for SET messages, to modify it's state. Actually this field is not strictly necessary, but it makes clear what this message is for.

content.raw:
We like to keep the coding style consistent in gazebo. There is a coding style checker script that you can run from gazebo root directory:

~~~
sh tools/code_check.sh
~~~

can you run this and fix the style errors
content.html:
We like to keep the coding style consistent in gazebo. There is a coding style checker script that you can run from gazebo root directory:

sh tools/code_check.sh

can you run this and fix the style errors

content.raw:
normally we try to avoid having gl specific calls, can you describe what part the code requires this extension?

Looking at the [spec](https://www.opengl.org/registry/specs/ARB/seamless_cube_map.txt), this is supported in opengl 3.1?
content.html:
normally we try to avoid having gl specific calls, can you describe what part the code requires this extension?

Looking at the spec, this is supported in opengl 3.1?
